definition: lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Li Busu was familiar with the route so they made rapid progress. He turned this way and that through open crevices .
sentences.chinese: 李不俗駕輕就熟，在那些嵌裂透漏的縫隙中鑽來轉去。

sentences.english: Some people have a facility for driving and others do not.
sentences.chinese: 一些人駕輕就熟，其他人則否。

sentences.english: The more you create the better you become at making your ideas a reality.
sentences.chinese: 創造得越多，在實現想法上面你就會更駕輕就熟。

definition: lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
to be at the scene (sitting for an exam, performing, competing, giving directions etc)/firsthand (experience)/impromptu (remarks etc)
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
